get.description: Get the details required to create a beneficiary depending on the beneficiary type, currency and country.

parameters.name: bankAccountCountry
parameters.description: Two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country code where the beneficiary bank account is held. e.g. `GB`

parameters.name: bankAccountCurrency
parameters.description: Three-letter [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) currency code in which the beneficiary bank account is held. e.g. `EUR`

post.description: Pix is a way to send money in BRL from funds deposited in an OpenPayd account. Payments to Brazil can be initiated using a recipientâ€™s alias, known as a Chave Pix. To enable payments and transfers, users can receive a registered Pix key using four options: CPF/CNPJ, cellphone number, email, and random key. The random key, generated by the Brazilian Central Bank, is composed of 32 characters, including letters and symbols, and is tied to a single account, offering a method to receive Pix payments without disclosing personal information.

accountId.description: Encrypted `id` of the account from where the payout will be made. e.g.`cWc4SktyWlkxM0hwcmdYe6FMdXRSQT09`

exchangeSourceAccountId.description: Encrypted `id` of the account from where the exchange will be made. e.g.`cWc4SktyWlkxM0hwcmdYe6FMdXRSQT09`
